snippet: New options from Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and the F.H.A. require some research by would-be borrowers, who may decide it’s better to wait and save.
abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column assesses several new options for prospective home buyers who have only a little money to put down as deposit; notes that while these options are far preferable to subprime mortgages, home buyers have to evaluate whether it would be best to save more before taking advantage of low-down-payment options.
lead_paragraph: New options from Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and the F.H.A. require some research by would-be borrowers, who may decide it’s better to wait and save.

headline.print_headline: Home Loan Programs Let Buyers Put Less Down
headline.main: Home Loan Programs Let Buyers Put Less Down

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
